meanings.definition: To change the landscape of an area.
meanings.sent1: They decided to relandscape the backyard to create a new garden.
meanings.sent2: The company will relandscape the park to make it more appealing to visitors.
meanings.sent3: After the storm, the wind seemed to relandscape the sand dunes overnight.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could relandscape the gloomiest of moods.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes relandscape the canvas into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The act of altering the appearance of a landscape.
meanings.sent1: The relandscape of the city park brought new life to the community.
meanings.sent2: His job involves planning and executing various relandscapes in urban areas.
meanings.sent3: The sudden snowfall created a beautiful relandscape of the mountains.
meanings.sent4: The relandscape of the garden was so dramatic, it felt like a scene from a fairy tale.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the relandscape of the countryside in a stunning painting.
